leaseText:
APARTMENT LEASE AGREEMENT  STATE OF TEXAS - COUNTY OF ___Collin______________  This Lease Agreement ("Lease") is entered into as of the   1st day of January, 2024  ("Effective Date") by and between:  LANDLORD/PROPERTY OWNER:  Name: _ABC Holdings__________________________________  Address: _1753 Bonaventure________________________________  City, State, ZIP: _Mckinney, TX 75070____________________________  Phone: _123-456-7890___________________ Email: _abc@bite.me____________  TENANT:  Name:   Tom Platz  Apartment Number: #123  Phone: _456-789-1234___________________ Email: _abcd@biteback.you_________  1. PROPERTY DESCRIPTION  The Landlord agrees to lease to the Tenant, and the Tenant agrees to lease from the Landlord, the following described residential property:  Name: _ABC Holdings__________________________________  Address: _1753 Bonaventure________________________________  City, State, ZIP: _Mckinney, TX 75070_  Unit Number:   ___123_________   Square Footage:   1,000 sq ft  Bedrooms:   2   Bathrooms:   ___   Type of Unit:   Apartment  The property is described for tax purposes as: ______dwelling__________________
2. LEASE TERM  Lease Start Date:   February 15, 2025  Lease End Date:   February 14, 2026  Lease Duration:   One (1) Year  This Lease shall commence on the Lease Start Date and shall continue through the Lease End Date, at which time this Lease shall terminate unless renewed in writing by mutual agreement of both parties. Either party may terminate this Lease by providing written notice at least thirty (30) days prior to the Lease End Date.  3. RENT AND PAYMENT TERMS  3.1 Monthly Rent Amount:   $___1200________________________  3.2 Rent Payment Due Date:   The ___1__ day of each month  3.3 Payment Method and Location:  Rent shall be paid to:  Payee Name: __ABC Holdings_________________________________  Name: _ABC Holdings__________________________________  Address: _1753 Bonaventure________________________________  City, State, ZIP: _Mckinney, TX 75070_  Payment Method:   ☐   Check   ☐   Money Order   ☐   Electronic Transfer   ☐   Other: _________  3.4 Late Payment Fees:  If rent is not received by the due date, Tenant shall pay a late fee of $_1000_ or _100__ % of monthly rent (whichever is greater), not to exceed the lesser of actual damages sustained or one month's rent. Late fees shall be due within five (5) days of the late rent payment.  3.5 NSF Fees:  If a check or electronic payment is returned for insufficient funds, Tenant shall pay an NSF fee of $_35____ per occurrence, in addition to late rent charges.  3.6 Rent Increases:  Landlord may increase rent upon renewal of this Lease with written notice of at least thirty (30) days prior to the Lease End Date. No rent increase shall occur during the initial Lease term unless specified in writing and signed by both parties.
4. SECURITY DEPOSIT  4.1 Security Deposit Amount:   $1,000.00  4.2 Receipt and Holding:  Tenant shall pay the security deposit of $1,000.00 to Landlord upon execution of this Lease.  The security deposit shall be held by Landlord as security for the faithful performance by  Tenant of all terms, covenants, and conditions of this Lease.  4.3 Use of Security Deposit:  The security deposit may be used by Landlord to cover:  ●   Unpaid rent or utilities  ●   Damages to the property beyond normal wear and tear  ●   Cleaning costs necessary to return the property to its original condition  ●   Any breach of lease terms  ●   Any other charges permitted under Texas Property Code Chapter 92  4.4 Return of Security Deposit:  Within thirty (30) days after the termination of this Lease and Tenant's vacation of the  property, Landlord shall:  ●   Return the security deposit in full, or  ●   Provide an itemized written notice of any deductions  Any itemized deduction notice shall include a description of each item, the date of the damage  or charge, and the cost of repair or replacement. Landlord shall provide Tenant with paid  receipts or invoices for repairs or professional cleaning.  4.5 Non-Refundable Fees:  The following fees (if charged) are non-refundable and separate from the security deposit:  ●   Application fee: $____50_______________________  ●   Pet fee (if applicable): $__50_________________________  ●   Move-in fee (if applicable): $___________________________  4.6 Interest:  Interest shall not accrue on the security deposit unless required by local ordinance.  5. UTILITIES AND SERVICES  5.1 Tenant Responsibility:  Tenant shall be responsible for the following utilities and services:
☐   Electricity   ☐   Natural Gas   ☐   Water   ☐   Sewer   ☐   Trash/Garbage   ☐   Internet   ☐   Cable   ☐  Other: _________________  5.2 Landlord Responsibility:  Landlord shall be responsible for the following utilities and services:  ☐   Electricity   ☐   Natural Gas   ☐   Water   ☐   Sewer   ☐   Trash/Garbage   ☐   Internet   ☐   Cable   ☐  Other: _________________  5.3 Utility Responsibility Acknowledgment:  If Landlord provides any utilities, Landlord shall not be liable to Tenant if the utility is  interrupted or fails. However, Landlord shall promptly notify the utility company of any  interruption and shall make reasonable efforts to restore service.  6. MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS  6.1 Tenant Maintenance Obligations:  Tenant shall:  ●   Keep the property and all contents in good, clean, and sanitary condition  ●   Dispose of garbage and trash properly in designated receptacles  ●   Not permit accumulation of garbage or trash  ●   Maintain any yard, patio, or balcony areas in a clean condition  ●   Keep the property free of pests and rodents  ●   Report any maintenance issues or damage to Landlord within two (2) business days of  discovery  ●   Maintain all air conditioning and heating systems in proper working condition  6.2 Landlord Maintenance Obligations:  Landlord shall:  ●   Maintain the structural integrity of the building  ●   Maintain the roof, foundation, and exterior walls  ●   Maintain all electrical, plumbing, heating, and cooling systems  ●   Make repairs necessary to keep the property in a habitable condition  ●   Maintain common areas in clean and safe condition  ●   Comply with all applicable building codes and habitability standards  6.3 Repair Request Procedures:  Tenant shall submit all repair requests in writing to Landlord. Landlord shall make ordinary  repairs within fourteen (14) days of receipt of the repair request. Emergency repairs (such as  lack of heat, water, or electricity) shall be addressed within twenty-four (24) hours.
6.4 Emergency Maintenance:  For emergency maintenance, Tenant may contact: _________________________  (Landlord/Manager Phone Number)  7. ENTRY AND INSPECTIONS  7.1 Landlord Entry:  Landlord or Landlord's agent may enter the property for the following reasons:  ●   To make repairs or perform maintenance  ●   To show the property to prospective tenants or buyers  ●   To conduct inspections  ●   To address emergency situations  ●   To verify compliance with lease terms  7.2 Notice Requirements:  Landlord shall provide Tenant with at least twenty-four (24) hours' written notice before  entering the property, except in emergency situations where immediate entry is necessary.  Notice shall include the purpose of entry and the approximate time of entry.  7.3 Access During Lease Term:  Tenant shall not unreasonably withhold access to the property for the purposes specified in  Section 7.1. Tenant shall cooperate with Landlord regarding access to the property.  8. OCCUPANCY AND USE  8.1 Permitted Occupancy:  The property may be occupied by Tenant and the following persons only:  Names: ____Tom Platz_______________________________  Number of Occupants: _____ (not to exceed _____ persons)  Tenant shall not allow additional persons to occupy the property without prior written  consent from Landlord.  8.2 Permitted Use:  The property shall be used solely as a private residential dwelling by Tenant and authorized  occupants. The property shall not be used for:  ●   Commercial purposes  ●   Illegal activities
●   Short-term rentals or vacation rentals (less than 30-day terms)  ●   Operation of a home-based business without written consent  ●   Any purpose that violates local zoning laws  8.3 Noise and Conduct:  Tenant shall maintain the property in a manner that does not disturb the quiet enjoyment of  neighboring tenants or the Landlord. Tenant shall refrain from excessive noise, especially  between 10:00 PM and 8:00 AM.  8.4 Illegal Activity:  Tenant shall not engage in any illegal activity at the property. Landlord may immediately  terminate this Lease if Tenant or any occupant engages in criminal activity.  9. PETS  9.1 Pet Policy:  ☐   No pets permitted  x ☐   Pets permitted with the following restrictions:  ●   Pet Type(s) Allowed: _____________________________  ●   Maximum Number of Pets: _____  ●   Pet Weight Limit (if applicable): _____ lbs  ●   Pet Breed Restrictions: _____________________________  ●   Pet Deposit: $500  ●   Pet Rent (Monthly): $___________________________  9.2 Pet Conditions:  If pets are permitted, Tenant agrees to:  ●   Keep pets under control at all times  ●   Clean up after pets immediately  ●   Not allow pets to disturb neighboring residents  ●   Maintain current vaccinations as required by law  ●   Provide proof of vaccination upon request  ●   Pay all costs for any damage caused by pets  ●   Remove all pet waste from common areas  9.3 Violations:  Unauthorized pets or violation of pet conditions shall constitute a material breach of this  Lease and may result in termination of tenancy.
10. PROHIBITED ITEMS AND  CONDUCT  Tenant shall not bring into, possess, or maintain at the property any of the following:  ●   Flammable materials (except normal household amounts of cleaning supplies)  ●   Hazardous materials or explosives  ●   Illegal drugs or controlled substances  ●   Firearms, weapons, or ammunition (unless in compliance with applicable laws)  ●   Certain animals or exotic pets  ●   Waterbeds (unless permitted in writing)  ●   Hazardous waste  Tenant shall not:  ●   Paint or alter the property without written consent  ●   Hang pictures or decorations that damage walls  ●   Drill holes or install fixtures that damage the property  ●   Smoke in the unit or common areas (if non-smoking)  ●   Use the property for gambling or illegal activities  11. SMOKING POLICY  Smoking Status:   ☐   Non-Smoking Unit   ☐   Smoking Permitted   ☐   Limited Smoking Areas  11.1 Smoking Restrictions:  If this is a non-smoking unit, Tenant shall not smoke tobacco, marijuana, or any other  substance in the unit, common areas, or exterior areas within 25 feet of the building.  11.2 Third-Party Smoke:  Tenant shall be responsible for ensuring guests and occupants comply with smoking  restrictions.  11.3 Violation Consequences:  Violation of smoking restrictions shall result in fines as follows: $_____ per violation, and  may result in lease termination.  12. PARKING
12.1 Parking Assignment:  Tenant is assigned the following parking space(s):  Space Number(s): ____________________________  Parking Location: ____________________________  12.2 Parking Rules:  Tenant shall:  ●   Park only in assigned spaces  ●   Maintain a current vehicle registration  ●   Display valid parking permit (if required)  ●   Not store non-functional vehicles  ●   Not perform major repairs or maintenance in parking areas  ●   Not exceed one vehicle per assigned space  12.3 Parking Violations:  Vehicles parked in violation of these rules may be towed at Tenant's expense. Landlord shall  not be liable for damage to vehicles during towing.  12.4 Guest Parking:  Guest parking is available at: ____________________________  Guests shall not park in assigned tenant spaces without permission.  13. ABANDONMENT  13.1 Definition:  The property shall be deemed abandoned if:  ●   Tenant vacates without notifying Landlord  ●   Tenant fails to pay rent for more than 30 days  ●   Rent is unpaid and Tenant cannot be contacted  ●   Tenant's possessions are removed from the property for more than 7 consecutive days  and rent is unpaid  13.2 Abandoned Property:  If the property is deemed abandoned, Landlord may:  ●   Enter the property and remove Tenant's possessions  ●   Store or dispose of Tenant's property  ●   Declare the property available for re-lease
●   Pursue collection of all outstanding rent and charges  13.3 Tenant Liability:  Tenant shall be liable for all costs associated with abandonment, including storage, disposal,  and re-leasing expenses, in addition to remaining lease obligations.  14. LEASE TERMINATION AND  MOVE-OUT  14.1 Notice of Non-Renewal:  If either party does not intend to renew this Lease, written notice of at least thirty (30) days  must be provided prior to the Lease End Date.  14.2 Move-Out Procedures:  Upon termination of this Lease, Tenant shall:  ●   Vacate the property by 10:00 AM on the Lease End Date  ●   Remove all personal possessions  ●   Clean the property thoroughly, including:  o   All walls, floors, and ceilings  o   All appliances and fixtures inside and out  o   Cabinets, drawers, and closets  o   Light fixtures and ceiling fans  o   Bathrooms (including tile, grout, and fixtures)  o   Carpets or flooring (professional cleaning if required)  o   Windows, screens, and blinds  ●   Dispose of all trash and debris  ●   Return all keys, access cards, and property items  ●   Provide forwarding address in writing  ●   Leave the property in the same condition as at lease commencement, normal wear  and tear excepted  14.3 Move-Out Inspection:  Landlord shall conduct a move-out inspection within five (5) days of lease termination.  Tenant may request to be present during this inspection. Any damages beyond normal wear  and tear will be deducted from the security deposit.  14.4 Key Return:  All keys must be returned to Landlord by 10:00 AM on the Lease End Date. Failure to return  keys shall result in a lock change fee of $_____ charged to Tenant.
15. EARLY TERMINATION  15.1 Early Termination by Tenant:  If Tenant terminates this Lease before the Lease End Date without cause, Tenant shall:  ●   Provide written notice of at least sixty (60) days  ●   Pay an early termination fee equal to: _____ (to be specified)  ●   Pay all rent through the lease termination date  ●   Remain responsible for rent until the property is re-leased or the original lease end  date, whichever occurs first  15.2 Early Termination by Landlord:  Landlord may terminate this Lease early for:  ●   Material breach by Tenant not cured within seven (7) days of written notice  ●   Tenant engaging in illegal activity  ●   Tenant's failure to pay rent  ●   Violation of occupancy limits  15.3 Military Exception:  Tenant who is an active duty member of the military may terminate this Lease with thirty  (30) days' written notice and a copy of military orders or deployment orders. No early  termination fee shall apply.  16. TENANT'S INSURANCE AND  LIABILITY  16.1 Renter's Insurance:  Tenant is strongly encouraged to obtain renter's insurance covering:  ●   Personal belongings  ●   Liability coverage  ●   Loss of use coverage  16.2 Landlord's Insurance:  Landlord shall maintain insurance on the building structure. This insurance shall NOT cover  Tenant's personal belongings or liability.  16.3 Tenant's Liability:  Tenant shall be liable for:

recovery_estimate.confidence_note: Moderate-to-strong case. Outcome depends on landlord response and any claimed deductions.
recovery_estimate.disclaimer: These are informational estimates only. Actual recovery depends on many factors including court proceedings, landlord response, and specific facts. This is not legal advice.

strategy.rationale: Your case has legitimate claims but some factors create uncertainty. Requesting a written itemization (if not received) and/or proposing a direct resolution may be more practical than immediate court filing.
strategy.success_rate_note: Cases with moderate leverage often resolve through direct negotiation.

next_steps.action: Send a written request for itemization (if not received)
next_steps.notes: Request in writing via certified mail. Reference § 92.104 if helpful to include.
Compare claimed deductions against your move-out condition. Normal wear and tear is not a legitimate deduction.
Document the condition you left the property in. Organize all correspondence.

next_steps.action: Consider proposing a direct resolution if communication is open
next_steps.notes: Sometimes direct negotiation produces faster results than court proceedings.

strategy.if_no_response: If the landlord does not respond to your written request, you may want to evaluate whether filing in small claims court makes sense given the deposit amount and your available time.

escalation_path.phase_3: Small claims filing as a last resort

defenses.title: Landlord Must Prove Claims
defenses.key_point: Under Texas law, a landlord who withholds or deducts from a deposit must provide a written itemized list of deductions (§ 92.104). The burden is on the landlord to document and justify each charge. General or vague claims without itemization or supporting receipts are difficult to enforce.
what_to_ask_landlord: Please provide a written, itemized list of all deductions with specific amounts
Please provide receipts for any repairs or professional services charged
Please provide before and after photos documenting the claimed damage
evidence_helpful: All documentation showing you left the property in reasonable condition
Lease agreement showing what you agreed to

damage_defense.strategic_note: No specific damage concerns detected from your notes. The burden-of-proof defense applies to any deductions the landlord may claim.
damage_defense.disclaimer: These defense points are informational only and based on general principles. Specific legal strategies should be discussed with a licensed Texas attorney.

leverage_points.title: $1,000 Deposit Withheld — 23 Days Until Statutory Deadline
leverage_points.why_this_matters: Your landlord has not returned your $1,000 deposit or provided any written explanation of deductions. Texas Property Code § 92.103 gives landlords 30 calendar days to return the deposit or provide a written itemization of deductions. That deadline is unknown—23 days from now. Under § 92.109, a landlord who fails to meet this deadline in bad faith may lose the right to withhold any portion of the deposit and may face additional liability.

recommended_steps.description: If you have not already done so, send your forwarding address to your landlord in writing today—certified mail is best. Under § 92.107, your landlord's 30-day clock runs from when they receive your forwarding address. Sending it now creates a clear paper trail and ensures the deadline is unambiguous.

Write out a simple timeline now: your move-out date, when you provided your forwarding address, any communications with your landlord, and the statutory deadline (unknown). If the deadline passes without a refund or itemization, this documentation will support a written demand or small claims filing.

statutory_references.title: Security Deposit
statutory_references.summary: Defines what constitutes a security deposit under Texas law.

statutory_references.title: Obligation to Refund
statutory_references.summary: Establishes the 30-day timeline for returning deposits or providing itemization.

statutory_references.title: Retention of Security Deposit; Accounting
statutory_references.summary: Specifies permissible reasons for retaining a security deposit.

statutory_references.title: Liability of Landlord
statutory_references.summary: Establishes landlord liability for bad faith retention of deposits.

procedural_steps.title: Gather Your Documents
procedural_steps.description: Collect everything related to your rental in one place: (1) your signed lease, (2) move-in condition report or photos, (3) move-out photos, (4) deposit payment receipt, (5) any emails, texts, or letters with your landlord, (6) proof of forwarding address delivery if sent.
checklist: Forwarding address proof (certified mail receipt if applicable)

procedural_steps.title: Confirm Your Forwarding Address
procedural_steps.description: If you have not already done so, send your forwarding address to your landlord in writing today—certified mail is best. Under § 92.107, your landlord's 30-day clock runs from when they receive your forwarding address. Sending it now creates a clear paper trail and ensures the deadline is unambiguous.

procedural_steps.title: Document Your Timeline
procedural_steps.description: Write out a simple timeline now: your move-out date, when you provided your forwarding address, any communications with your landlord, and the statutory deadline (unknown). If the deadline passes without a refund or itemization, this documentation will support a written demand or small claims filing.

procedural_steps.title: Learn About Your Options
procedural_steps.description: If your written demand is not resolved, Texas Justice of the Peace courts handle small claims up to $20,000. Filing fees are typically $50-100. You may also consult with a licensed Texas attorney.

resources.title: TexasLawHelp.org — Security Deposits
resources.description: Free guide to Texas security deposit rights

disclaimers.primary: This report is provided for informational and document preparation purposes only. It does not constitute legal advice and does not create an attorney-client relationship. For advice specific to your legal situation, consult a licensed Texas attorney.
disclaimers.jurisdiction: This analysis applies Texas law only (Tex. Prop. Code § 92.101 et seq.).
disclaimers.estimates: Recovery estimates and win probability figures are informational tools only based on general case factors. They do not guarantee any outcome.
